articles.title: 'I don't want to raise my kids in America, it's unsafe' - Lindsay Myeni wants SA citizenship - News24
articles.description: The wife of Lindani Myeni wants to raise her kids in SA because she does not believe it is safe for black children in the United States.
articles.content:
• The wife of Lindani Myeni wants to move to SA to raise her children.
  • She says, after the shooting and killing of her husband by US police, she is afraid for her children's safety.

articles.title: Boxing: Pacquiao in 'final stages' of talks for Mikey Garcia fight, says aide - CNA
articles.description: MANILA: Philippine boxing great Manny Pacquiao is in the "final stages" of talks for a bout against American star Mikey Garcia, an aide to the Filipino fighter said Thursday (May 6).
articles.content:

articles.title: Filipinos can play for Mega Millions' $370M lottery jackpot - CNN Philippines
articles.description: Without leaving the country, Filipinos can now join the American Mega Millions' Friday draw as the jackpot soared to an amount equivalent to ₱17.7 billion.
articles.content: Metro Manila (CNN Philippines) - The American Mega Millions lottery is offering in its upcoming draw on Friday night a jackpot worth $370 million (17.7 billion), currently the world's biggest lottery… [+4146 chars]

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Sotheby’s to accept bitcoin, ethereum for Banksy auction - The Indian Express
articles.description: Digital artwork by American artist Mike Winkelmann, who is better known as Beeple, sold for nearly $70 million at Christie's in March, in the first-ever sale by a major auction house of a piece of art that does not exist in physical form
articles.content: Sotheby’s said on Tuesday it would accept bitcoin and ethereum as payment for Banksy’s iconic artwork Love is in the Air, a first for a physical art auction and the latest sign of growing mainstream … [+1109 chars]

articles.title: Cherished American right behind social media ban on Donald Trump - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: You can’t force a company to provide service to a jerk. That is the simple truth behind the Facebook and Insta ban on the former president.
articles.content:
But that, sigh, is where we are. The Oversight Board posted its ruling on the web, using the sexy headline, FB-691QAMHJ: Case decision 2021-001-FB-FBR.
